alert.note: Alert for Castro; Parmer (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 27 at 3:14AM CDT until May 27 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Castro County in the panhandle of Texas... Northeastern Parmer County in the panhandle of Texas... * Until 500 AM CDT. * At 314 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Summerfield and Black. Considerable flash flooding is likely along US Highway 60 in and around Summerfield. Although only light rain remained across the area, flash flooding is still likely. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
